words.definition: Actual means that something is real or true.
words.example: This is the actual sword that the king used, not a copy.

words.definition: To amaze someone is to surprise them very much.
words.example: The magician amazed the audience with his tricks.

words.definition: A charge is the price to pay for something.
words.example: The charge for the service was ten dollars.

words.definition: To comfort someone means to make them feel better.
words.example: I wanted to comfort my friend after her dog died.

words.definition: To contact someone is to speak or write to them.
words.example: I contacted my teacher by email.

words.definition: A customer is a person who buys something at a store.
words.example: The customer put a few items in her basket.

words.definition: To deliver something is to take it from one place to another.
words.example: The man delivered some food to my house.

words.definition: To earn means to get money for the work you do.
words.example: He earns a lot of money by working around the house.

words.definition: A gate is a type of door. It is often made of metal or wood.
words.example: We want to put a high gate around our house.

words.definition: To include something means to have it as part of a group.
words.example: Does this meal include a drink?

words.definition: To manage something is to control or be in charge of it.
words.example: I had to manage the shop while my boss was away.

words.definition: A mystery is something that is difficult to understand or explain.
words.example: The identity of the killer is still a mystery.

words.definition: To occur is to happen.
words.example: When did the accident occur?

words.definition: If something is opposite, it is completely different.
words.example: The opposite of white is black.

words.definition: A plate is a flat dish used for eating or serving food.
words.example: I put my dinner on a large plate.

words.definition: To receive something is to get it.
words.example: I received a present on my birthday.

words.definition: A reward is something given in exchange for good behavior or work.
words.example: He was given a reward for his hard work.

words.definition: To set something is to put it in a certain place.
words.example: Please set the book on the table.

words.definition: To steal is to take something that is not yours.
words.example: The man tried to steal money from the bank.

words.definition: A thief is a person who steals.
words.example: A thief broke into our house while we were away.
